page.title: 03EAST GRINSTEAD HIGH STREET
page.content: The High St is the heart of the old town, and many timber framed buildings in the wide market street give the town great character. It is a Conservation Area. The High St is divided by the buildings of Middle Row, itself of 14C origin. The West end of the High St is a shopping street with a number of retail outlets and service shops. The east end has a different character with the north side generally in commercial use while the south is largely residential. We have 3 surviving 14C houses, albeit much added to over the years. 16 buildings date from the period 1400-1540, with a further 14 Elizabetan or Jacobean. Little was built in the 18C and the remaining fine buildings are of 19 or 20C origin.The old road is 7' below present level due to centuries of wear
